body:
Comment 18: 
If you are going to do this, why not put the code inside the range loop body?

The only situation I can think of where you can't do this is you have
goroutines locking a map, grabbing an entry, unlocking the map,
and then processing the entry.  For that you'd be better off with
a channel anyway, most likely.

I'm not claiming it never happens, just that it's usually a sign of
something else wrong with the code anyway.

Russ
